sense.name: a spot, a point or region in space
sense.commentary: LOCATION[+extent][+spatial][+point/+region] a point or extent in space
sense.examples: Two electrons cannot be in the same location at the same time. Across from the bank would be a good location for our store. The movie was filmed entirely on location. The restaurant probably closed because it was not in a convenient location.

sense.name: the action of placing or situating an object
sense.commentary: LOCATION[+action][+situate][+object] locating, position, positioning, emplacement - the act of putting something in a certain place or location Note: implies an agent or actor determines where the object goes, does not just discover where the object is - see Sense 3 for that meaning.
sense.examples: THeir location of the new housing next to the library annoyed many townspeople. Mary's location of the shelves next to the window blocks out too much light.

sense.name: the act of determining or discovering the position of an object
sense.commentary: LOCATION[+action][+discover][+coordinates][+spatial][+object] a determination of the location of something Note: implies the object is already at a location, not put there - see Sense 2 for that meaning
sense.examples: He got a good location on the target. Their location of the signal indicates that it comes from deep space, not our galaxy.
